urls.title: Horror at destruction of nationally important UK river | The Wildlife Trusts
urls.description: Major damage to River Lugg in Herefordshire will be test case for Government commitment to strengthen wildlife protection.

tweets.text:
A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

Terrible to hear about this eco-vandalism at #RiverLuggSSSI in #Herefordshire

It's a clear breach of environmental legislation, and test case for @DefraGovUK @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency enforcement

We @WildlifeTrusts will be following it very carefully https://t.co/YZpRTggpl4

tweets.text: @edfenergy @EnvAgency @SayNo2SizewellC https://t.co/X04mlBmwCW These animals are listed as vulnerable to extinction. Do not harm them. Stop Sizewell C. https://t.co/qeLReFqLQx

.@EnvAgencyMids is calling for those responsible for stripping away trees from a mile of the River Lugg to be prosecuted. 
@HerefordshireWT says decades of damage has been done, destroying an important habitat for fish, birds and mammals. https://t.co/8NHPrlu2m9

BEFORE & AFTER

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

THIS IS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY

So it's a CRITICAL TEST CASE for environmental enforcement by @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK

The @WildlifeTrusts will be making sure appropriate legal action is taken https://t.co/U8lt4ZuX1t

@CraigBennett3 @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @WildlifeTrusts I am shocked that in these days of instant digital and social media that this type of destruction can be done unnoticed? What have the local community said about this development? Not a criticism but can you muster local councillors, MP's and other people in the area to back up

@KKAJ1234 @Mammoth_Spotter @DJ_Renney @inthesticks @Feargal_Sharkey @MilesKing10 @GeorgeMonbiot @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @EnvAgency @HfdsCouncil @HerefordshireWT Yes great interview from @HelenStace_HWT on BBC R4 Today programme https://t.co/HOtPxQfSDt
About 50 minutes in. Really laid it on the line.

tweets.text: @RobGMacfarlane @silverpebble @EnvAgency So it‚Äôs thought local landowners are responsible? Absolutely horrific - being a designated SSSI doesn‚Äôt seem to offer much protection, does it. This *must* be investigated and prosecuted, and severe penalties/prison imposed.

I've often ask the question "And the @EnvAgency does what exactly?"

Transpires we now have an answer. It's not a lot.

"The Environment Agency attended just 292 water pollution incidents, down from 1,726 during the same period in 2019". @bilgribs 

https://t.co/Hbcmxyl5pI

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @bilgribs I instigated a meeting between Hackney Council and the EA to talk about the river Lea. The EA officer explained that they now have to rely on polluters like Thames Water to report themselves. Imagine how well that‚Äôs going.
@RobGMacfarlane @silverpebble @EnvAgency Why???
@CraigBennett3 @SteveCJjones @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @WildlifeTrusts Is that really the same view? River looks like it bends to the left in the image on the left?

When certain things happen, it's easy (and fair) to be angry with @EnvAgency but even @Feargal_Sharkey will agree coal-face EA staff, especially in Fisheries & Biodiversity teams are hard working, passionate people doing hard jobs. It's the backbone of the top brass that fail us

@timthefruit @HelenStace_HWT @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Yes there are but budget cuts but that cannot be the catch-all. They lack the direction from senior leadership and the will to act. This is probably policy driven. They have to be more energetic and act as enforcers of environmental law in a swift and effective way.

‚ÄúThe Govt has promised UK to be a world leader in envir protection. Devastating incidents such as this vital 'test case'.. Unfortunately, Govt has failed to live up to this standard, with poor resourcing leaving Natural England unable to properly monitor & protect our SSSIs‚Äù https://t.co/qvK2WWkQku
@JuneMccarthy10 @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency Absolutely! Shocking and depressing

@KKAJ1234 @Mammoth_Spotter @DJ_Renney @inthesticks @Feargal_Sharkey @MilesKing10 @GeorgeMonbiot @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @EnvAgency @HfdsCouncil @HerefordshireWT Yes great interview from @HelenStace_HWT on BBC R4 Today programme https://t.co/HOtPxQfSDt
About 50 minutes in. Really laid it on the line.

domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.
